term.title: photodeconjugation

item.text: Photoinduced reaction of conjugated compounds (e.g., enones and carboxylic acid derivatives) leading to loss of conjugation. [image: Not defined]

notes.item: This reaction has important synthetic applications for the synthesis of frameworks of numerous natural products, such as β,γ-unsaturated carboxylic acids from photoexcitation of α,β-unsaturated carboxylic acid derivatives, excluding the use of strong bases, as required for similar isomerizations performed in the ground state.

sources.item: PAC, 2007, 79, 293. 'Glossary of terms used in photochemistry, 3rd edition (IUPAC Recommendations 2006)' on page 389 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac200779030293)
